medical_qa.normalized_answer: Orthostatic myoclonus is a potential cause of unsteadiness in individuals with neurodegenerative diseases and can be underdiagnosed. Electromyography surface recording can assist in evaluating unexplained unsteadiness.

medical_qa.question: Is the cell death in mesial temporal sclerosis apoptotic?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Apoptosis may not be involved in cell loss in mesial temporal sclerosis based on the study findings.

medical_qa.question: Contrast-enhanced MR imaging of hand and finger joints in patients with early rheumatoid arthritis: do we really need a full dose of gadobenate dimeglumine for assessing synovial enhancement at 3 T?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Half-dose gadobenate dimeglumine at 3-T MR imaging may be sufficient for assessing synovitis or tenosynovitis in early RA.

medical_qa.question: Does laparoscopic cholecystectomy influence peri-sinusoidal cell activity?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Laparoscopic procedures caused detectable damage to Kupffer and endothelial cells as reflected by elevation of post-operative HA serum levels.

medical_qa.question: Does case-mix based reimbursement stimulate the development of process-oriented care delivery?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Hospital management can stimulate the development of care programmes by adopting case-mix reimbursement within hospitals' budgeting processes.

medical_qa.question: Risk of risky sexual behavior among college students with ADHD and the role of the mother-child relationship
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Female college students with ADHD may engage in unprotected sex. A positive mother-child relationship could be protective for college students with ADHD regarding risky sexual behaviors.

medical_qa.question: Is rotator cuff tear considered an occupational disease?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Occupational exposure may increase the risk or lead to the clinical manifestation of rotator cuff tears, as suggested by the study findings.

medical_qa.question: Is there a need for pelvic CT scan in cases of renal cell carcinoma?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Pelvic CT is not necessary for most cases of renal cell carcinoma and should be done selectively to reduce costs.

medical_qa.question: Prognostic factors for cervical spondylotic amyotrophy: are signs of spinal cord involvement associated with the neurological prognosis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: High signal intensity change on T2-weighted MRI and pyramidal tract sign are prognostic factors for patients with cervical spondylotic amyotrophy.

medical_qa.question: Does the elicited motor response predict the success rate of parasacral sciatic nerve block?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Eliciting a tibial motor response predicts a higher success rate than eliciting a peroneal motor response with parasacral sciatic nerve block.

medical_qa.question: Is Bare-Metal Stent Implantation Still Justifiable in High Bleeding Risk Patients Undergoing Percutaneous Coronary Intervention?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: E-ZES implantation is more effective and safe than BMS in HBR patients with stable or unstable coronary artery disease.

medical_qa.question: Ovarian torsion in children: is oophorectomy necessary?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Detorsion is the procedure of choice for most cases of ovarian torsion in children, as it was not associated with increased morbidity and patients had functioning ovarian tissue on follow-up.

medical_qa.question: Does minimal access major surgery in the newborn hurt less?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Minimal access surgery for esophageal atresia or congenital diaphragmatic hernia does not result in lower cumulative opioid doses.

medical_qa.question: Does aerobic fitness influence microvascular function in healthy adults at risk of developing Type 2 diabetes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: In the 'at-risk' group, higher aerobic fitness levels were associated with better microvascular and endothelial responsiveness.

medical_qa.question: Are high flow nasal cannulae noisier than bubble CPAP for preterm infants?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: At the gas flows studied, HFNC are not noisier than BCPAP for preterm infants.

medical_qa.question: Nutritional assessment of gluten-free diet. Is gluten-free diet deficient in some nutrient?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The gluten-free diet has minimal deficiencies, similar to those present in the diet with gluten, with an improvement in the lipid profile by increasing the proportion of monounsaturated fatty acids to the detriment of saturated fatty acids.

medical_qa.question: Standardizing care in medical oncology: are Web-based systems the answer?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Factors affecting the uptake and use of a Web-based protocol system for medical oncology in the Australian setting vary based on clinician roles, experience, hospital location, and environmental factors. Clinician-specific and environmental issues impact attitudes and use of the system. Education, infrastructure, hospital policy, and endorsement play key roles in the ongoing use of the Web-based system.

medical_qa.question: Antiretroviral therapy related adverse effects: Can sub-Saharan Africa cope with the new 'test and treat' policy of the World Health Organization?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Sub-Saharan Africa is not currently prepared to manage the increased burden of ART-related toxic and metabolic complications that would result from implementing the 'test and treat' policy of the WHO. Urgent measures are needed to address this issue.

medical_qa.question: Are the elderly with oropharyngeal carcinoma undertreated?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Elderly patients with oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma (OPSCC) are receiving less treatment compared to younger individuals. Survival analysis shows significant benefits from aggressive treatments in older age groups.

medical_qa.question: Preoperative staging of patients with liver metastases of colorectal carcinoma. Does PET/CT really add something to multidetector CT?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: PET/CT has limited utility in hepatic staging of LMCRC. While it may have higher sensitivity for detecting extrahepatic disease in specific locations, its positive predictive value is low. PET/CT provided additional information in 8% of cases but also incorrect data in 9% of cases. Selective use in patients at high risk of local recurrence is suggested.

medical_qa.question: Can myometrial electrical activity identify patients in preterm labor?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Myometrial electrical activity can differentiate false from true preterm labor and enhance identification of patients in true premature labor.

medical_qa.question: Schizophrenia patients with high intelligence: A clinically distinct sub-type of schizophrenia?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Patients with high pre-morbid IQ in schizophrenia show fewer negative symptoms compared to typical schizophrenia patients, suggesting the existence of a high-IQ variant of schizophrenia.

medical_qa.question: Is ankle/arm pressure predictive for cardiovascular mortality in older patients living in nursing homes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: AAI is not predictive for IHD mortality in nursing home residents. Traditional risk factors and PAD are less important predictors of death in this population compared to poor functional status, nutritional factors, and previous cardiovascular disease.

medical_qa.question: Is nasogastric decompression useful in prevention of leaks after laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Routine placement of nasogastric tube in patients operated of LSG does not seem useful in reducing leaks' incidence.

medical_qa.question: Can physician-examiners participate from a distance in the objective structured clinical examination (OSCE)?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: OSCE ratings by on-site and remote examiners were reasonably comparable when using checklists, suggesting that remote examination may be feasible for assessing students' clinical skills. Further validity evidence is needed before recommending it for high-stakes examinations.

medical_qa.question: Does CPAP therapy improve quality of life and sleep in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and obstructive sleep apnea?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: CPAP treatment in IPF patients with OSA significantly improves daily living activities based on the FOSQ. Improvement was also noted in other quality of life questionnaires, though not statistically significant, likely due to the complex effects of IPF on health. Poor CPAP compliance was common and required intensive follow-up by clinic staff.

medical_qa.question: Does open access endoscopy close the door to an adequately informed patient?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Patients undergoing open access endoscopy are less likely to be properly informed about their endoscopic procedure.

medical_qa.question: Is hypoalbuminemia an independent prognostic factor in patients with gastric cancer?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Hypoalbuminemia is not an independent predictor of survival in patients with gastric cancer. Its association with poorer survival is influenced by the presence of a systemic inflammatory response, as indicated by elevated CRP levels.

medical_qa.question: Can the postoperative pain level be predicted preoperatively?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Factors present preoperatively such as prior surgical pain, duration and intensity of prior pain, preoperative pain intensity, and depression can predict significant postoperative pain.

medical_qa.question: Proliferative index obtained by DNA image cytometry. Does it add prognostic information in Auer IV breast cancer?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Proliferative index (S + G2/M fraction) obtained by DNA image cytometry can provide prognostic information in Auer IV breast cancer.

medical_qa.question: Does skin care frequency affect the severity of incontinence-associated dermatitis in critically ill patients?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: A study compared the incidence and severity of incontinence-associated dermatitis (IAD) in critically ill patients receiving a defined skin care protocol at different frequencies. The group receiving the protocol every 6 hours had a lower incidence of moderate IAD compared to the group receiving it every 12 hours.

medical_qa.question: Is primary angioplasty an acceptable alternative to thrombolysis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Patients and carers found reorganization of care to offer a primary angioplasty service acceptable. Satisfaction levels were high regardless of the type of care received, except for discharge and aftercare.

medical_qa.question: Should HIV-infected patients be screened for silent myocardial ischaemia using gated myocardial perfusion SPECT?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Screening for silent myocardial ischaemia using myocardial SPECT may be more likely to be positive in male HIV-infected patients older than 52 years with at least two other cardiovascular risk factors.

medical_qa.question: Does the aggressive use of polyvalent antivenin for rattlesnake bites result in serious acute side effects?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The administration of polyvalent Crotalidae antivenin is safe with acute side effects mainly being urticaria, and serious side effects are uncommon.

medical_qa.question: Do resident's leadership skills relate to ratings of technical skill?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: General surgery research residents' intraoperative leadership skills correlated with their perceptions of skill decay and task difficulty during a bowel repair.

medical_qa.question: The FOOTSTEP self-management foot care programme: are rheumatoid arthritis patients physically able to participate?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Approximately 57% of rheumatoid arthritis patients in the study were physically able to undertake some aspects of self-managed foot care.

medical_qa.question: Is there an association between CYP2D6*4 allele and breast cancer risk?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The presence of the CYP2D6*4 allele seems to decrease susceptibility to breast carcinoma in the selected population.

medical_qa.question: Does base deficit predict mortality in patients with severe traumatic brain injury?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Base deficit is correlated with Glasgow Coma Scale at presentation and Revised Trauma Score, but it is not a reliable prognostic marker for outcome and mortality in patients with isolated traumatic brain injury.

medical_qa.question: Does increased use of private health care reduce the demand for NHS care?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Increased private health care activity does not reduce the demand for NHS care: NHS and private referral rates were positively associated with each other after adjusting for age, deprivation and practice.

medical_qa.question: Does confined placental mosaicism account for adverse perinatal outcomes in IVF pregnancies?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The incidence of confined placental mosaicism is not increased in IVF/ICSI pregnancies compared with spontaneous conceptions. Therefore, CPM probably does not account for the adverse perinatal outcomes following IVF/ICSI.

medical_qa.question: Utility of unenhanced fat-suppressed T1-weighted MRI in children with sickle cell disease -- can it differentiate bone infarcts from acute osteomyelitis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Unenhanced T1-W fat-saturated MRI is not reliable for differentiating bone infarcts from osteomyelitis in children with sickle cell disease.

medical_qa.question: Cancer of the buccal mucosa: are margins and T-stage accurate predictors of local control?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Low T-stage and negative margins are not adequate predictors of local control in buccal mucosa cancers. Adjuvant therapy may be beneficial even for early tumors to improve local control.

medical_qa.question: Can mass drug administration lead to the sustainable control of schistosomiasis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Mass drug administration alone was not enough to control the prevalence, intensity, and morbidity of schistosomiasis in the study population.

medical_qa.question: Can D-dimer become a new diagnostic parameter for acute appendicitis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Increased D-dimer levels should not be considered as a diagnostic parameter in the diagnosis of acute appendicitis.

medical_qa.question: Is there a relationship between rheumatoid arthritis and periodontal disease?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Individuals with moderate to severe periodontal disease are at higher risk of suffering from rheumatoid arthritis and vice versa.

medical_qa.question: Do clinical variables predict pathologic radiographs in the first episode of wheezing?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Clinical variables, either isolated or as components of a model, could not identify all children with pathologic radiographs.

medical_qa.question: Globulomaxillary cysts--do they really exist?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Globulomaxillary cyst as a distinct entity is no longer considered justified based on study results and international literature.

medical_qa.question: Is there a significant difference in the adenoma detection rate between MiraLAX and Golytely?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Golytely was more efficacious than MiraLAX in bowel cleansing and was independently associated with higher adenoma detection rates. Further studies with larger populations are needed to confirm these findings.

medical_qa.question: Does government assistance improve utilization of eye care services by low-income individuals?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Low-income individuals use vision care services less often despite government assistance.

medical_qa.question: Does telmisartan prevent hepatic fibrosis in rats with alloxan-induced diabetes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Telmisartan may reduce type-I diabetes mellitus-induced hepatic injury by suppressing activated hepatic stellate cells through concomitant TGF-beta1 down-regulation.

medical_qa.question: Two-year follow-up survey of patients with allergic contact dermatitis from an occupational cohort: is the prognosis dependent on the omnipresence of the allergen?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Patients with contact urticaria had a poorer prognosis than those with contact allergy, and there was a trend towards a poorer prognosis for those with contact allergy to rubber chemicals than those with allergy to epoxy. Job change was associated with improvement.

medical_qa.question: Can calprotectin predict relapse risk in inflammatory bowel disease?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Calprotectin may help identify UC and colonic CD patients at higher risk of clinical relapse.

medical_qa.question: Can nurse-led preoperative education reduce anxiety and postoperative complications of patients undergoing cardiac surgery?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Preoperative education by nurses decreased anxiety and postoperative complications in cardiac surgery patients, but did not reduce readmissions or length of stay.

medical_qa.question: Is there a discrepancy between patient and physician quality of life assessment?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Physicians often differ from patients in the assessment of Quality of Life, highlighting the importance of patient-evaluated QoL in clinical assessment.

medical_qa.question: Impact of MPH programs: contributing to health system strengthening in low- and middle-income countries?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: MPH graduates showed considerable impact in their workplaces and at the national level, aligning with public health educational goals. The qualitative study provided insights into graduates' influence and career progression.

medical_qa.question: Is diffusion-weighted imaging a significant indicator of the development of vascularization in hypovascular hepatocellular lesions?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Signal intensity on DWI did not show a significant difference in the development of vascularization in hypovascular hepatocellular lesions.

medical_qa.question: Are failures of anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction associated with steep posterior tibial slopes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Failures of ACLR were associated with significantly steeper medial and lateral posterior tibial slopes compared to the control group. A medial or lateral PTS ≥5° was identified as a new risk factor for ACLR failure.

medical_qa.question: Does evidence-based practice improve patient outcomes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Evidence-based practice (EBP) was associated with better patient outcomes and more efficient performance compared to standard practice (SP).

medical_qa.question: Multidisciplinary decisions in breast cancer: does the patient receive what the team has recommended?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Most multidisciplinary team decisions in breast cancer management are implemented, with management alterations often due to patient choice or additional information available after the MDT.

medical_qa.question: Does quilting suture prevent seroma in abdominoplasty?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Quilting suture appears to be effective in preventing seroma formation in abdominoplasty.

medical_qa.question: Does feeding tube insertion and its timing improve survival?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Neither insertion of PEG tubes nor timing of insertion affect survival.

medical_qa.question: Does prostate morphology affect outcomes after holmium laser enucleation?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Trilobar prostate morphology is associated with a greater decrease in post-void residual urine volume after holmium laser enucleation. Other outcomes are similar between trilobar and bilobar prostates. A 2-lobe technique can be considered for trilobar prostates.

medical_qa.question: Do acute changes in heart rate by isoproterenol affect aortic stiffness in patients with hypertension?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Aortic stiffness was not affected by acute changes in heart rate induced by isoproterenol in hypertensive patients.

medical_qa.question: Can magnetic resonance substitute for diagnostic arthroscopy in detecting occult posttraumatic lesions of the knee?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: MRI can be a valuable tool in detecting and characterizing occult bone and/or cartilage injuries in patients with post-traumatic knee pain, acute joint blocks, and negative radiographs, potentially avoiding the need for diagnostic arthroscopy.

medical_qa.question: Could ESC (Electronic Stability Control) change the way we drive?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Behavioral adaptation to ESC is likely in some drivers, but its effectiveness in reducing serious crashes is still significant. Balanced education and realistic marketing of ESC-equipped vehicles are recommended.

medical_qa.question: Is the insertion allele of the ACE gene I/D polymorphism a candidate gene for insulin resistance?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The ACE gene insertion/deletion polymorphism is not associated with insulin resistance or abnormalities in fibrinolysis. However, NIDDM subjects with the ACE DD genotype showed increased insulin sensitivity.

medical_qa.question: Do ventricular arrhythmias in athletes subside over time?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Ventricular arrhythmias in athletes tend to decrease over time, especially when engaged in non-competitive sports.

medical_qa.question: Does ethnicity affect where people with cancer die?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Location of death varies by country of birth. BAME groups are more likely to die in a hospital and less likely to die at home or in a hospice.

medical_qa.question: Are patients with serious mental illness more likely to be admitted to nursing homes with more deficiencies in care?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Patients with schizophrenia or bipolar disorder (SMI) were more likely than other patients to be admitted to nursing homes with higher deficiency citations for both overall quality and clinical care quality.

medical_qa.question: Does an additional antirotation U-Blade (RC) lag screw improve treatment of AO/OTA 31 A1-3 fractures with gamma 3 nail?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The U-Blade (RC) lag screw did not reduce the cut-out rate in the treatment of OTA/AO 31A1-3 fractures. Longer surgery duration and higher costs associated with the U-Blade (RC) lag screw did not justify its use in this study.

medical_qa.question: Is the Omega-3 Index a new risk factor for death from coronary heart disease?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The Omega-3 Index is proposed as a new risk factor for death from coronary heart disease, inversely associated with CHD mortality.

medical_qa.question: May mean platelet volume levels be a predictor in the diagnosis of pelvic inflammatory disease?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Mean platelet volume (MPV) value was significantly decreased in patients with PID, suggesting it may be a valuable marker in the diagnosis of PID.

medical_qa.question: Do cytokine concentrations in pancreatic juice predict the presence of pancreatic diseases?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Interleukin-8 concentration in pancreatic juice can discriminate between normal pancreas and pancreatic diseases, aiding in diagnosis.

medical_qa.question: Does the sex of acute stroke patients influence the effectiveness of rt-PA?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Sex is not a significant predictor of recanalization rate, time to recanalization, or 3-month outcome in stroke patients following IV rt-PA.

medical_qa.question: Are head and neck specific quality of life measures necessary?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Head and neck-specific quality of life measures are necessary and should include domains that reflect eating/swallowing, speech/communication, and appearance.

medical_qa.question: Is there an association between occupational arsenic exposure and diabetes mellitus among Swedish art glass workers?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Limited support for the possibility that occupational arsenic exposure could play a role in the development of diabetes mellitus among Swedish art glass workers.

medical_qa.question: Does SYNTAX score predict in-hospital outcomes in patients with ST elevation myocardial infarction undergoing primary percutaneous coronary intervention?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: SYNTAX score (SxS) can predict in-hospital outcomes for patients with ST elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) undergoing primary percutaneous coronary intervention (pPCI).

medical_qa.question: Is micro-computed tomography reliable to determine the microstructure of the maxillary alveolar bone?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Micro-CT is reliable for assessing bone density and microstructure of the maxillary alveolar bone, correlating with conventional histomorphometry.

medical_qa.question: Does use of hydrophilic guidewires significantly improve technical success rates of peripheral PTA?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The use of hydrophilic guidewires significantly improved technical success rates of peripheral PTA, especially in occlusions and more complicated lesions.

medical_qa.question: Does frozen section alter surgical management of multinodular thyroid disease?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Frozen section did not alter intraoperative management in patients undergoing thyroidectomy for multinodular thyroid disease over the last decade, suggesting routine frozen section may not be necessary.

medical_qa.question: Could chest wall rigidity be a factor in rapid death from illicit fentanyl abuse?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Chest wall rigidity may contribute to rapid death from illicit IV fentanyl use, indicated by fentanyl and norfentanyl concentrations suggesting a quick onset of death, with some cases showing high fentanyl levels and no norfentanyl detected.

medical_qa.question: Is severe pain immediately after spinal augmentation a predictor of long-term outcomes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Patients with severe pain immediately after vertebroplasty have similar long-term outcomes compared with patients without severe pain.

medical_qa.question: Can computerised tomography replace bone scintigraphy in detecting bone metastases from breast cancer?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: CT (thorax, abdomen, and pelvis) can detect bone metastases from breast cancer, suggesting that routine bone scans may not be necessary in patients with metastatic breast cancer.

medical_qa.question: Does obesity impact the pattern and outcome of trauma in children?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Obesity does not significantly affect injury severity, mortality, types of injury, and procedure outcomes in children. However, obese children are more prone to rib and pelvic injuries.

medical_qa.question: Is non-invasive diagnosis of esophageal varices in patients with compensated hepatic cirrhosis possible by duplex Doppler ultrasonography?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The splenoportal index (SPI) was accurate in predicting the presence or absence of esophageal varices in patients with compensated cirrhosis.

medical_qa.question: Is (18)F-FDG a surrogate tracer to measure tumor hypoxia?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: FDG is not a good surrogate tracer for tumor hypoxia under ambient or hypoxic conditions. Specific hypoxia tracers should be used instead.

medical_qa.question: Can dogs prime autistic children for therapy?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study provides evidence supporting the idea that dogs can positively influence the behavior of children with autism spectrum disorder during therapy sessions.

medical_qa.question: Are 99mTc leukocyte scintigraphy and SBFT studies useful in children suspected of having inflammatory bowel disease?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: 99mTc-WBC is useful as an initial screening modality to exclude IBD and is more sensitive than UGI-SBFT studies.

medical_qa.question: Risk factors for avascular necrosis of bone in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus: is there a role for antiphospholipid antibodies?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: No significant link was found between the presence of antiphospholipid antibodies and the development of avascular necrosis in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus, even after adjusting for corticosteroid use.

medical_qa.question: Prostate bed target interfractional motion using RTOG consensus definitions and daily CT on rails : Does target motion differ between superior and inferior portions of the clinical target volume?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: No statistically significant differences in motion were found between superior and inferior portions of the clinical target volume (SUP-CTV and INF-CTV).

medical_qa.question: Esophagogastric devascularization without splenectomy in portal hypertension: safe and effective?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Esophagogastric devascularization without splenectomy is a safe and effective treatment for esophagogastric varices in selected patients with portal hypertension, showing lower complications compared to conventional treatment.

medical_qa.question: Does maternal obesity have an influence on feeding behavior of obese children?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Maternal obesity does not significantly influence the feeding behavior of obese school children. Mothers' BMI correlates with children's BMI-z-scores, and the degree of child's obesity increases mothers' concern and food restriction behavior.

medical_qa.question: Is plate clearing a risk factor for obesity?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Plate clearing tendency is associated with increased body weight and may be a risk factor for weight gain.

medical_qa.question: Should lower limb fractures be treated surgically in patients with chronic spinal injuries?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Surgical treatment of lower limb fractures in patients with chronic spinal cord injuries may lead to better clinical outcomes, range of motion, bone consolidation, and fewer pressure ulcers and radiological misalignments compared to orthopaedic treatment.

medical_qa.question: Is vancomycin MIC creep a worldwide phenomenon?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study did not find evidence of vancomycin MIC creep in their institution during the study period, suggesting it may not be a generalized phenomenon.

medical_qa.question: Does short-term treatment with proton pump inhibitors cause rebound aggravation of symptoms?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: There is no rebound aggravation of symptoms after a 5-day treatment with lansoprazole 60 mg once daily in patients with reflux symptoms.

medical_qa.question: Do family physicians make good sentinels for influenza?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Family physicians provide sensitive, timely, and accurate community influenza morbidity data that complement data from other surveillance systems.

medical_qa.question: Aberrant loss of dickkopf-3 in gastric cancer: can it predict lymph node metastasis preoperatively?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Loss of DKK3 protein expression in gastric cancer was associated with poor survival, advanced TNM stage, and could potentially enhance the accuracy of CT staging for predicting lymph node involvement.

medical_qa.question: Is ganglionated plexi ablation during Maze IV procedure beneficial for postoperative long-term stable sinus rhythm?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Ganglionated plexi ablation did not show benefit for maintaining stable sinus rhythm postoperatively. Complete left atrial lesion set and biatrial ablation are recommended for better rhythm outcomes.

medical_qa.question: Is double reading of barium enemas necessary?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Double reading of barium enemas does not improve sensitivity for detection of polyps and produces a higher false-positive rate.

medical_qa.question: Is severe macrosomia manifested at 11-14 weeks of gestation?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Severe macrosomia can be detected as early as 11-14 weeks of gestation.

medical_qa.question: Do older adults with cancer fall more often?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The fall rate was higher in older adults with cancer than in older adults without cancer.

medical_qa.question: Should a scrotal approach be the first choice for both palpable and impalpable undescended testes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Scrotal incision can be recommended for orchidopexy, even in difficult cases of impalpable undescended testes, with advantages such as shorter operative time, cosmetically appealing single incision, and potentially less pain. The technique reduces the need for laparoscopy in impalpable testes and allows successful orchidopexy of abdominal testes if an open processus is present.

medical_qa.question: Is grandmultiparity an independent risk factor for adverse perinatal outcomes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Grandmultiparous women had increased maternal and neonatal morbidity, and neonatal mortality even after controlling for confounders.

medical_qa.question: Does the investing layer of the deep cervical fascia exist?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study suggests that the investing cervical fascia does not exist in the anterior triangle of the neck.

medical_qa.question: Is crime associated with over-the-counter pharmacy syringe sales?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: OTC pharmacy syringe sales were not associated with increases in reported crime in local communities in Los Angeles during 2006-2008.

medical_qa.question: Is prophylactic fixation a cost-effective method to prevent a future contralateral fragility hip fracture?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Prophylactic fixation with a cephalomedullary nail was not found to be cost-effective for the average older woman who sustained a hip fracture. However, it may be appropriate for select patient populations.

medical_qa.question: Is double-balloon enteroscopy an accurate method to diagnose small-bowel disorders?

medical_qa.question: Is muscle power related to running speed with changes of direction?

medical_qa.question: Is bicompartmental knee arthroplasty more favourable to knee muscle strength and physical performance compared to total knee arthroplasty?

medical_qa.question: Are neighbourhood social capital and availability of sports facilities related to sports participation among Dutch adolescents?

medical_qa.question: Did the call for boycott by the Catholic bishops affect the polio vaccination coverage in Kenya in 2015?

medical_qa.question: Does airway surgery lower serum lipid levels in obstructive sleep apnea patients?

medical_qa.question: Is digoxin use for cardiovascular disease associated with risk of prostate cancer?

medical_qa.question: Are income-related differences in active travel associated with physical environmental characteristics?

medical_qa.question: Can Roux-en-Y gastric bypass provide a lifelong solution for diabetes mellitus?

medical_qa.question: Do the changes in the serum levels of IL-2, IL-4, TNFalpha, and IL-6 reflect the inflammatory activity in the patients with post-ERCP pancreatitis?

medical_qa.question: Is routine intraoperative frozen-section examination of sentinel lymph nodes in breast cancer worthwhile?

medical_qa.question: Is preoperative platelet count a prognostic factor in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma?

medical_qa.question: Can we predict urinary stone composition based on an analysis of microelement concentration in the hair and urine?

medical_qa.question: Could ADMA levels in young adults born preterm predict an early endothelial dysfunction?

medical_qa.question: Can fractional lasers enhance transdermal absorption of topical lidocaine in an in vivo animal model?

medical_qa.question: Does intra-abdominal desmoid disease affect patients with an ileal pouch differently than those with an ileorectal anastomosis?

medical_qa.question: Does anastomotic leakage affect functional outcome after rectal resection for cancer?

medical_qa.question: Can clinical supervision sustain our workforce in the current healthcare landscape?

medical_qa.question: Are women who are treated for hypothyroidism at risk for pregnancy complications?

medical_qa.question: Internal derangement of the temporomandibular joint: is there still a place for ultrasound?

medical_qa.question: Do emergency medical services professionals think they should participate in disease prevention?

medical_qa.question: Is the clinical significance of bile duct sludge different from bile duct stones?

medical_qa.question: What is the role of transesophageal echocardiography in assessing left ventricular function in brain-dead patients for heart transplantation?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Transesophageal echocardiography is useful in assessing left ventricular function in brain-dead heart donors. medical_qa.question: Hepatorenal syndrome: are we missing some prognostic factors?

medical_qa.question: Does patient-prosthesis mismatch after aortic valve replacement affect survival and quality of life in elderly patients?

medical_qa.question: Reporting and interpreting red blood cell morphology: is there discordance between clinical pathologists and clinicians?

medical_qa.question: Is inhibin a new circulating marker of hydatidiform mole?

medical_qa.question: Comparative safety of infliximab and etanercept on the risk of serious infections: does the association vary by patient characteristics?

medical_qa.question: Are there progressive brain changes in schizophrenia?

medical_qa.question: Should all human immunodeficiency virus-infected patients with end-stage renal disease be excluded from transplantation?

medical_qa.question: Does ambulatory process of care predict health-related quality of life outcomes for patients with chronic disease?

medical_qa.question: Women with synchronous primary cancers of the endometrium and ovary: do they have Lynch syndrome?

medical_qa.question: Does the aggressive use of polyvalent antivenin for rattlesnake bites result in serious acute side effects?

medical_qa.question: Can calprotectin predict relapse risk in inflammatory bowel disease?

medical_qa.question: Are failures of anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction associated with steep posterior tibial slopes?

medical_qa.question: Could chest wall rigidity be a factor in rapid death from illicit fentanyl abuse?

medical_qa.normalized_answer: Maternal obesity does not significantly influence the feeding behavior of obese school children, although there is a correlation between mothers' and children's BMI.

medical_qa.question: Is vancomycin MIC creep a worldwide phenomenon?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study did not find evidence of vancomycin MIC creep in their institution during the study period, suggesting it may not be a widespread phenomenon.

medical_qa.question: Aberrant loss of dickkopf-3 in gastric cancer: can it predict lymph node metastasis preoperatively?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Loss of DKK3 protein expression in gastric cancer was associated with poor survival and correlated with TNM stage. DKK3 may be a potential biomarker for lymph node involvement, enhancing the predictive accuracy of CT staging.

medical_qa.question: Is crime associated with over-the-counter pharmacy syringe sales?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: OTC pharmacy syringe sales were not associated with increases in reported crime in local communities in Los Angeles during 2006-2008.

medical_qa.question: Does airway surgery lower serum lipid levels in obstructive sleep apnea patients?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Airway surgery may improve blood lipid levels in patients with obstructive sleep apnea, especially in those with preoperative dyslipidemia, potentially benefiting metabolism and cardiovascular health. Prospective studies are needed to further investigate this metabolic effect.

medical_qa.question: Does Mammographic Density have an Impact on the Margin Re-excision Rate After Breast-Conserving Surgery?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Mammographic density is not associated with an increased need for re-excision or resection of unnecessary margins at initial BCS.

medical_qa.question: Is endometrial polyp formation associated with increased expression of vascular endothelial growth factor and transforming growth factor-beta1?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Increased expression of TGF-β1 and VEGF was observed in endometrial polyps compared to adjacent normal endometrial tissue, suggesting a potential role of these cytokines in endometrial polyp formation. There was also a significant correlation between steroid receptor expression and VEGF and TGF-β1 expression.

medical_qa.question: Does bone anchor fixation improve the outcome of percutaneous bladder neck suspension in female stress urinary incontinence?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study found that bone anchor fixation did not significantly improve the success rate of percutaneous bladder neck suspension in female stress urinary incontinence compared to other techniques.

medical_qa.question: Fatigue in primary Sjögren's syndrome: is there a link with the fibromyalgia syndrome?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study found that fatigue in patients with primary Sjögren's syndrome (pSS) and secondary Sjögren's syndrome (sSS) is not primarily associated with fibromyalgia (FM). The incidence of FM in patients with pSS in the United Kingdom was lower than previously reported.

medical_qa.question: Is resected stomach volume related to weight loss after laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Mean %EBWL after LSG did not significantly differ among patients grouped by resected stomach volume. Resected stomach volume was higher in patients with a greater preoperative body mass index.

medical_qa.question: Resection of colorectal liver metastases after second-line chemotherapy: is it worthwhile?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Resection of colorectal liver metastases after second-line chemotherapy can result in similar overall survival compared to first-line chemotherapy. For initially unresectable patients, outcomes are comparable between first- and second-line chemotherapy.

medical_qa.question: Do ART patients face higher C-section rates during their stage of delivery?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Patients after ART treatment have higher rates of C-sections during delivery.

medical_qa.question: Does a preoperative medically supervised weight loss program improve bariatric surgery outcomes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Medically supervised weight management program did not show additional benefit compared to standard preoperative bariatric surgery protocol in terms of weight loss and most behavioral outcomes after laparoscopic adjustable gastric banding.

medical_qa.question: Is solitary kidney really more resistant to ischemia?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Solitary kidney in a canine model is more resistant to ischemia than paired kidneys based on radiological, pathological and genetic evidence.

medical_qa.question: Neck pain treatment with acupuncture: does the number of needles matter?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The number of needles (5 or 11) does not significantly impact the therapeutic effect when the stimulation time is the same in both groups.

medical_qa.question: Does fluoridation reduce the use of dental services among adults?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Fluoridation reduces oral disease among adults aged 20 to 34 years with private dental insurance, but its impact on the use of restorative services varies based on dentists' clinical decisions.

medical_qa.question: Pertrochanteric fractures: is there an advantage to an intramedullary nail?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: No statistically significant difference was found between intramedullary nail and sliding compression hip screw for low-energy pertrochanteric fractures AO/OTA 31-A1 and A2 in terms of operative, radiologic, and clinical outcomes.

medical_qa.question: Is there a correlation between essential tremor and Parkinson's disease based on SPECT study with I-123-Ioflupane (DaTSCAN)?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: The study did not find a correlation between essential tremor and Parkinson's disease. Essential tremor patients showed some degree of striatal dopaminergic degeneration, but the cause is unclear. Further studies are needed to monitor disease progression and understand the reason for this degeneration.

medical_qa.question: Are the GFRUP's recommendations for withholding or withdrawing treatments in critically ill children applicable?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: GFRUP's recommendations for treatment limitation in critically ill children were mostly applicable, with some challenges in scheduling meetings and involving nurses in the process.

medical_qa.question: Is inhaled prophylactic heparin useful for prevention and Management of Pneumonia in ventilated ICU patients?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Nebulized heparin is not recommended for prophylaxis against VAP or to hasten recovery from pneumonia in patients receiving MV.

medical_qa.question: Is the h-index predictive of greater NIH funding success among academic radiologists?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Having obtained at least one NIH grant was associated with a higher h-index, yet multiple or large grants were not predictive of higher h-indices.

medical_qa.question: Is minimally invasive mitral valve repair with artificial chords reproducible and applicable in routine surgery?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Minimally invasive mitral valve repair using neochords showed high repair rate, reproducibility, and stability during follow-up, making it a preferred technique for mitral valve surgery.

medical_qa.question: Does obesity predict knee pain over fourteen years in women, independently of radiographic changes?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Higher BMI over 14 years predicts knee pain at year 15 in women, independently of radiographic knee osteoarthritis. The association is significant for bilateral knee pain but not unilateral, suggesting different underlying mechanisms. The impact of BMI on knee pain remains consistent over time, indicating its importance in addressing the burden of knee pain.

medical_qa.question: Do liquid-based preparations of urinary cytology perform differently than classically prepared cases?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Liquid-based preparations performed significantly better in urinary cytology challenges, especially for malignant categories and the exact reference interpretation of HGUCA, compared to classic preparations. Cytotechnologists outperformed pathologists in diagnosing all slide types and HGUCA cases.

medical_qa.question: Outcomes of severely injured adult trauma patients in an Australian health service: does trauma center level make a difference?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Severely injured patients treated at a level III trauma center had a higher mortality rate compared to those treated at a level I trauma center. Delays in care provision were identified as a significant issue, particularly in the emergency department.

medical_qa.question: Does a well developed collateral circulation predispose to restenosis after percutaneous coronary intervention?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: A well developed collateral circulation does not predict an increased risk of restenosis after PCI.

medical_qa.question: Are home sampling kits for sexually transmitted infections acceptable among men who have sex with men?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Home sampling kits for sexually transmitted infections were generally viewed positively among men who have sex with men, with benefits including increased access to testing, enhanced personal comfort, and empowerment. Concerns were raised about test accuracy, result delays, lack of support, and potential negative impact on others.

medical_qa.question: Does route of delivery affect maternal and perinatal outcome in women with eclampsia?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Early cesarean delivery in eclampsia cases at ≥34 weeks does not show significant improvement in maternal and perinatal outcomes compared to vaginal delivery.

medical_qa.question: Surgical management of the atherosclerotic ascending aorta: is endoaortic balloon occlusion safe?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Endoaortic occlusion was frequently ineffective and associated with a significantly higher risk of in-hospital death and a numerically higher risk of stroke.

medical_qa.question: Estradiol and Antagonist Pretreatment Prior to Microdose Leuprolide in in Vitro Fertilization. Does It Improve IVF Outcomes in Poor Responders as Compared to Oral Contraceptive Pill?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: E2+antag pretreatment does not improve IVF outcomes in ML protocol compared to OCP in poor responders. Further randomized trials are needed to study the optimal steroid pretreatment method.

medical_qa.question: Are opioid dependence and methadone maintenance treatment (MMT) documented in the medical record?

medical_qa.question: Do risk calculators accurately predict surgical site occurrences?

medical_qa.question: Does angiotensin-converting enzyme-1 (ACE-1) gene polymorphism lead to chronic kidney disease among hypertensive patients?

medical_qa.question: Can we ease the financial burden of colonoscopy?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Endoscopists in a tertiary care setting can accurately predict diminutive polyp histology and determine appropriate surveillance intervals, leading to cost savings per patient.

medical_qa.question: Does Molecular Genotype Provide Useful Information in the Management of Radioiodine Refractory Thyroid Cancers?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: BRAF mutation positively influenced progression-free survival in patients treated with tyrosine kinase inhibitors for radioiodine-refractory thyroid cancers, particularly in papillary thyroid carcinoma subtype. medical_qa.question: Can computerised tomography replace bone scintigraphy in detecting bone metastases from breast cancer?

medical_qa.question: Does maternal obesity have an influence on feeding behavior of obese children?

medical_qa.question: Do trauma center levels impact outcomes of severely injured adult trauma patients in an Australian health service?

medical_qa.question: Does high-dose radiotherapy benefit palliative lung cancer patients?

medical_qa.question: Malnutrition, a new inducer for arterial calcification in hemodialysis patients?

medical_qa.question: Does glomerular hyperfiltration in pregnancy damage the kidney in women with more parities?

medical_qa.question: Subclavian steal syndrome: can the blood pressure difference between arms predict the severity of steal?

medical_qa.question: Can the Internet be used to improve sexual health awareness in web-wise young people?

medical_qa.question: Is eligibility for a chemotherapy protocol a good prognostic factor for invasive bladder cancer after radical cystectomy?

medical_qa.question: Does left atrial appendage (LAA) occlusion device alter the echocardiography and electrocardiogram parameters in patients with atrial fibrillation?

medical_qa.question: Does escalation of the apical dose change treatment outcome in beta-radiation of posterior choroidal melanomas with 106Ru plaques?

medical_qa.question: Can patient coaching reduce racial/ethnic disparities in cancer pain control?

medical_qa.question: Does patient position during liver surgery influence the risk of venous air embolism?

medical_qa.question: Do Indigenous Australians age prematurely?

medical_qa.question: Are tuberculosis patients adherent to prescribed treatments in China?

medical_qa.question: Ultrasound in squamous cell carcinoma of the penis; a useful addition to clinical staging?

medical_qa.question: Do oblique views add value in the diagnosis of spondylolysis in adolescents?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: There is no difference in sensitivity and specificity between four-view and two-view studies. Oblique views do not provide additional diagnostic benefit compared to anteroposterior and lateral views.

medical_qa.question: Are many colorectal cancers due to missed adenomas?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: In normal daily practice, only a small number of clinically important adenomas are missed. The problem of missed adenomas probably is being exaggerated.

medical_qa.question: Does desflurane alter left ventricular function when used to control surgical stimulation during aortic surgery?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Desflurane effectively controls intraoperative hypertension in patients undergoing vascular surgery without significant negative effects on left ventricular function.

medical_qa.question: Does gestational age misclassification explain the difference in birthweights for Australian aborigines and whites?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Gestational age misclassification is an unlikely explanation for the reported divergence in average birthweights for Australian Aborigines and whites.

medical_qa.question: Is there any interest to perform ultrasonography in boys with undescended testis?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Ultrasonography is not recommended for diagnosing undescended testis.

medical_qa.question: Is peak concentration needed in therapeutic drug monitoring of vancomycin?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Peak concentration may not be needed in vancomycin therapeutic drug monitoring as trough concentration and minimum inhibitory concentration are sufficient to predict efficacy and safety.

medical_qa.question: Can autologous platelet-rich plasma gel enhance healing after surgical extraction of mandibular third molars?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Platelet-rich plasma gel reduced pain and improved bone healing after mandibular third molar surgery.

medical_qa.question: Are sugars-free medicines more erosive than sugars-containing medicines?
medical_qa.normalized_answer: Paediatric sugars-free (SF) medicines were not more erosive than sugars-containing (SC) medicines in vitro; dose form was a significant predictor of erosive potential.
